summary: Implemented a frontend deployment failure banner with Retry/Dismiss controls and a new `useRetryableDeployment` hook that tracks status and attempts, supports manual retry, and shows a toast when no previous attempt exists. However, the manual retry does not appear to re-run the most recently saved attempt parameters/state; the saved attempt data is not used to drive the retry.

missing_requirements.requirement: Clicking the retry control re-runs the same deployment attempt (using the most recently saved attempt parameters/state) rather than doing nothing.
missing_requirements.reason: The hook saves a deployment attempt (timestamp/options), but the `retry()` path only checks that an attempt exists and then runs `performDeployment` without using any saved parameters/state from `lastAttempt`.

hallucinated_features.description: Mock/randomized deployment behavior (simulated failures via Math.random and setTimeout) embedded in the retry/deploy hook.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest focuses on making retry UI/state reliable; it does not request introducing randomized mock deployment logic within the app code.
